title: Hosmer 2014 Lemberger (Cayuga Lake)
description: Equal parts light and dark, this Lemberger showcases ripe, concentrated black plum and cherry flavors layered in savory tones of dusty mineral, balsamic and mushroom. It's an elegant wine with a briskly acidic backbone and fine-grained but persistent tannins framing the finish.

title: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Deep aromas of black cherry, mocha and burnt cedar show on the nose of this bottling from one of the more ambitious producers in this region. Scorched black plum, charred black cherry, roasted beef and bay leaf show on the palate.

title: Murphy-Goode 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Fruity and fresh, this medium-bodied wine has dark plum and blackberry aromas, along with ripe and almost sweet blackberry flavors. A lightly gripping texture helps make it appetizing.

title: Fornaro 2015  Soave Classico
description: This opens with subtle scents of acacia flower, lemon peel and green apple. The bright juicy palate offers ripe pear and a hint of nectarine that carry through to the clean, juicy finish.

title: Podere Brizio 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Vibrant and poised, this charming red opens with scents of red berry, iris and aromatic herb. The luminous palate offers red cherry, mint and orange zest while a firm vein of acidity and supple tannins provide freshness and an easy-drinking structure. Drink through 2017.

title: Market Vineyards 2012 Basis Points Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon (60%), with the rest equal parts Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this offers aromas of vanilla, baking spice, green pepper and dark fruit, with the oak showing somewhat prominently. The palate brings well-balanced dark fruit and green-pepper flavors, with spice lingering on the finish.

title: Maryhill 2013 Marvell Elephant Mountain Vineyard G-S-M (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: This wine is mostly Syrah (47%), with the rest near equal parts Mourvèdre and Grenache. The aromas offer notes of cranberry and cherry, while the palate provides plump yet elegant fruit flavors, with barrel spices extending on the finish.

title: François Millet 2015  Sancerre
description: This initially soft, fruity wine shows its crisp side only gradually. As it opens, it reveals pure citrus fruits that are ripe, shot through with acidity and very ready to drink.

title: Lion-Gri 2015 Golden Land Dry Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)
description: A whiff of cotton candy leads the nose to aromas of black raspberry, black currant and tobacco leaf. In the mouth, there are flavors of blackberry, black plum and smoked sausage before the persistent finish.

title: McGregor 2012 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
description: Savory tones of moss, spice and toast juxtapose crisp red plum and cherry in this elegant Pinot Noir. Crisp acidity lends a delicate, dancing feel to the palate. Balanced and composed, its moderately long finish is marked by a hint of forest floor.

title: McManis 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Mouthwatering fruit flavors and a firm, dry mouthfeel make this medium-bodied wine easy to appreciate. It smells like fresh cherries and raspberries, tastes ripe and has a fine-grained texture.

title: Lamadrid 2015 Single Vineyard Bonarda (Agrelo)
description: Ripe oaky aromas include prune and raisin scents along with vanilla. This is somewhat rough and heavy in feel, with baked blackberry flavors and roasted meaty notes. A full blast of minty spicy oak controls the finish.

title: Landsman 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This earthy wine offers dusky, mossy aromas, raisin and light black-pepper flavors, and a touch of sweetness. It has full body and a soft, soothing texture.

title: Nora 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Peach, melon and citrus aromas are good but standard. This is edgy and sharp due to lean pointy acidity. As a result of that acidity, this is tart and citric in flavor, with little lees or yeasty richness to soften things up. A finish with stony, dry lime flavors is scouring.

title: One Woman 2015 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Musk melons, limes and lemons perfume this crisp, cutting Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is refreshingly citrusy, offering brisk grapefruit flavor accented by swathes of green leaf and herb. Full bodied yet spry, it's a neatly balanced wine to enjoy now through 2019.

title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: Old vines in the Côte de Beaune and the Côte Chalonnaise to the south give this wine concentration. It has juicy apricot and green-plum flavors that are spiced lightly with the wood aging. It is a crisp wine that is ready to drink.

title: SoDo 2014 Deadbird Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: It's an extreme rarity to find a Walla Walla Valley Cabernet Sauvignon at this price. Being 100% varietal, it offers reserved aromas of dates and plum. The flavors are full bodied and lush, exhibiting tacky tannins and whiffs of game.

title: St. Supéry 2013 Dollarhide Elevation Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dried herb and sage provide aromatic complexity before this full, generously styled wine takes on deeper, richer flavors of boysenberry, graphite and cedar. Soft oak and tannin provide approachability amid moderate structure.

title: Red Electra 2015 Moscato (California)
description: This sweet, low-alcohol, red version of Moscato is fantastically fruity and floral in aroma. Boysenberry and rose-petal flavors accompany a broad texture that clings to the palate on the finish.

title: Ridolfi 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This zesty red has pretty aromas that suggest small red berry, blue flower and a whiff of moist soil. The vibrant palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and a hint of anise alongside zesty acidity and refined tannins.

title: Waterbrook 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of vanilla, wood spice and dark fruit are followed by generous but still restrained black-fruit flavors. It shows a pretty sense of balance.

title: Suhru 2013 Shiraz (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Fleshy black plums and berries burst from nose to palate of this juicy lip-smacking Long Island Shiraz. It's approachably plush and round with a pleasantly clingy mouthfeel. A backdrop of sweet spice and fine, feather-tipped tannins extend the finish.

title: Swiftwater Cellars 2015 Olsen Vineyard Riesling (Yakima Valley)
description: Bright aromas of peach, lime leaf, jasmine and flowers lead to off-dry mandarin orange and floral flavors. It provides a lot of appeal, though the concentration at times doesn't seem all there.

title: Swiftwater Cellars 2015 Proprietary White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is two-thirds Sémillon and one-third Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of toasted grapenuts, lemon and spice are followed by broad-feeling fruit flavors that show a lightly creamy feel.

title: Te Mata 2014 Elston Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: To my mind, Te Mata's strength s are in its red wines. That said, this is a solid Chardonnay. Subtle wood shadings add richness to the flavors of mandarin orange and vanilla custard before ending on a persistent citrus-oil note.

title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Exotic citrus and orange blossom aromas are lively and a touch oily. This is racy and fresh, with substance to the mouthfeel. Peachy stone-fruit flavors hint at orange and lychee, while this is lasting and intense on the finish. Drink now.

title: Wind Rose 2013 Bravo Rosso Red (Washington)
description: Barbera makes up just over half of this wine, with the rest Primitivo, Cabernet Sauvignon, Nebbiolo and Dolcetto. Aromas of vanilla, wood spice and red cherry are followed by a tart lick of cherry and cranberry flavors.

title: Yves Leccia 2015 Domaine D'E Croce Rosé (Patrimonio)
description: Rich, fruity and soft, this wine has a tang of orange peel along with ripe citrus and red fruits. Fresh and crisp at the end, it is ready to drink.

title: Zeni 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and a whiff of grilled herb lead the nose on this robust red. The full-bodied, rather one-dimensional palate offers raisin, licorice and a hint of dark bitter chocolate alongside smooth enveloping tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol.

title: Trapiche 2016 Costa & Pampa Chardonnay (Buenos Aires)
description: This blend of coastal and desert grapes smells and tastes tropical, with floral notes and a preponderance of citrus character. There isn't too much variation to the flavor profile, which is centered on white citrus fruits.
